intro: Spermacoce thymocephala, commonly known as the small-leaf moonseed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
